Source.Name: pogo
Source.Summary: Probably the simplest and fastest audio player for Linux.
Source.Description: Pogo's elementary-inspired design uses the screen-space very efficiently. It is especially well-suited for people who organize their music by albums on the harddrive. The main interface components are a directory tree and a playlist that groups albums in an innovative way.Supported file formats include Ogg Vorbis, MP3, FLAC, Musepack, Wavpack, and MPEG-4 AAC. Pogo is a fork of Decibel Audio Player.
